It's neat, I'll give it that. However, you are better off getting the original if you want practically zero bugs and more players. The ragdolls are cool, though.

[h1]Half-Life Deathmatch: Source é um jogo multiplayer FPS inspirado nos mapas originais mas com a engine Source[/h1]

É um jogo bom, ainda tem alguns servidores com alguns players jogando, uma boa experiência mas infelizmente servers lagados, todas as vezes que fui estava com +200 de ping e acredito que seja pelo fato de eu ser br e jogar contra estrangeiros que são os únicos jogando ainda.
O jogo também tem um problema de crash aparentemente ocasionado por não funcionar corretamente no Windows 10, pode ser que não aconteça com você mas já aconteceu com conhecidos e aconteceu agora algumas vezes logo depois de umas 3 horas de jogo do nada, foram varios crashs e derrepente pararam.

Na minha opinião, o jogo é bom e deu pra me divertir mesmo com o lag que tornou algumas situações de troca de tiro bem engraçadas e aleatórias, principalmente usando a bazuca que leva + de 1 segundo pro missil sair dela ksksksks.

[b]Então finalizando...[/b]
Se você não se importar de jogar lagado pode comprar e mesmo se vc tiver o problema dos crashs, é provável que você consiga resolver pois tem solução no fórum do próprio jogo aqui no Steam. Então divirta-se!!

I was going to leave a negative review because I remember playing this game for the first time finding it completely dead.

But once I found an active server, I had the time of my life. Sure, there's probably better and more fun ways to play Half Life multiplayer, but I still had a great time. I love the weapon variety, the fast paced movement, the non-existent respawn times, and the salty adults who get mad if you treat the game childishly. It's fun!

[i]Half-Life Deathmatch: Source[/i] provides some slight entertainment, but is overall a victim of modern enhancement.

This was probably a solid title upon its initial release, providing players with endless hours of fun, but now it is something completely different. The age on this title shows, whether you're considering the lack of modern incentives for deathmatch games or the almost completely dead player base, it just can't compete with most modern titles. The base gameplay from [i]Half-Life[/i] is present, which is stellar when applied to the game it was made for, but it isn't anything special in this format, at least nowadays. The fun to be had here wears thin, I'm not sure whether this is due to growing up with much more complex online multiplayer or it is a weak format for a deathmatch in general, but before I even complete a match, I'm often left bored and it just makes me want to play the original [i]Half-Life[/i] instead. Every time I have attempted to play the game, only one map is available to play on because really nobody else is on any other server, so you're strictly limited to that single arena, which I'm assuming is the most popular, but it isn't nearly good enough to warrant hours of gameplay. 

In my review of [i]Half-Life: Source[/i], I have elaborated on how useless the graphical upgrade has been as a replacement for the original game's textures, as it takes away a lot of the stylized charm and does little to improve what is already there. The game is completely playable in its original state, and already includes the original deathmatch servers in the game itself, therefore buying this bundle is useless even if you wanted to try it out, as [i]Half-Life[/i] already comes with the full package. Really, the problems I have with the [i]Source[/i] version of the original are ones I have with the [i]Source[/i] version of the deathmatch title, even more so due to its sheer uselessness. 

One would likely enjoy this deathmatch title over a decade ago, but nowadays, you'd be much better off with a modern title, or at least a classic that has substance and a living player base. [i]Half-Life Deathmatch: Source[/i] gets old fast, and is once again a more negative than positive experience out to take your money. Unless you hold some sort of nostalgia or are an avid fan of this title, do not waste your money on the [i]Source[/i] version of [i]Half-Life: Source[/i] and [i]Half-Life Deathmatch: Source[/i], just purchase the original and enjoy it in its originally intended way if you are going to play the deathmatch at all.

I got surprisingly addicted to this game for a good while after I got this with Half-Life 1. From what I can say, this game offered some really good fun for my 10.5 hours of playtime thanks to it's well made maps and the use of the Half-Life 1 weapons, tools and mechanics which are well put into the deathmatch scenario of the game. In all honestly though, it isn't that unique compared to the newer online FPS games that can look, play and feel better, but this game has a very certain nostalgic feeling towards it that makes it special and this is coming from someone who has no nostalgic connection to half-life 1 at all but the really early 3-D graphics and well structured maps as mentioned before gave me a certain feeling that is almost impossible to recreate without the use of something old like this game.

It is quite a good game especially something running on the source engine but I would, without a doubt say get this on sale. I understand that sentence contradicts the positives I have mentioned about this product but a severe problem is that not many people play this game no more and a lot of the servers are empty, though you will occasionally find a map with a few actual players on and not just the somewhat terrible bots but the amount of money it is selling for now will deliver a pretty good deathmatch game using Half-Life 1 and the source engine but proceeds to lack what it needs most, that being actual players playing.

If you want this game, get it with Half Life 1 or the entire series if you can, get this game if you have some money you really do not have anything else to spend it on after all there are worse ways to over spend your money on something, get this game if you have a couple of friends that are also willing to get the game and see if you can all get into a server together if its possible or just get this game on sale as I have mentioned before.
